com.flurry.android.config.killswitch

Class KillSwitch

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flurry.android.config.killswitch.KillSwitch

  • public final class KillSwitch
extends Object
    Kill Switch plugin for Flurry Config. This provides developers the ability to terminate an old version that's not supported anymore, or suggest users to update to a newer version. Steps: 1. get an instance of FlurryConfig and Kill Switch. 2. create a kill switch listener which defines behaviors under different situations. 3. add one or more listener(s) to kill switch instance. 4. call killSwitchInstance.execute(). Please refer to class ConfigDemoActivity in flurryAndroidConfigTestApp for a full example.

        public static KillSwitch getInstance(FlurryConfig flurryConfig)
        Get a KillSwitch object.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        KillSwitch object.

      • addKillSwitchListener

        public void addKillSwitchListener(KillSwitch.KillSwitchListener killSwitchListener)
        Add a listener to the list as a hook into kill switch status. At least one listener is required. You can add multiple listeners as different entry points.
        Parameters:
        killSwitchListener - the listener

      • removeKillSwitchListener

        public void removeKillSwitchListener(KillSwitch.KillSwitchListener killSwitchListener)
        Remove a listener from the list. Always remember to remove the listener afterwards.
        Parameters:
        killSwitchListener - the listener

      • execute

        public void execute()
        Executes the kill Switch check.

      • getKillSwitchInfo

        public final KillSwitchInfo getKillSwitchInfo()
        Retrieves the last obtained kill switch info
        Returns:
        kill switch info

      • showDefaultDialog

        public void showDefaultDialog(android.app.Activity activity,
                              KillSwitchInfo killSwitchInfo)
        Show an alert dialog for kill switch. For kill config, it shows only one button to force users update the app; while for nag config, it provides two options - update, or dismiss.
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity that will show this alert dialog
        killSwitchInfo - The kill switch info object
